comments.body:
> `isInsideEmptyPackage`

There's a difference between the root package and empty package

- `_empty_` is the enclosing package for classes that are not defined inside a package
- `_root_` is the owner of all packages (including `_empty_`).

To work with SemanticDB symbols we normally use the following helpers
```scala
import scala.meta.internal.semanticdb.Scala._
val sym = "Toplevel."
Symbols.Global(EmptyPackage, sym) // "_empty_/Toplevel."
```

I will use `isInsideDefaultPackage`. When I hear "it is inside an empty package" then I think: How can it be an empty package if it has something inside.
Or maybe `isInsideUnnamedPackage`? :)

The â€œempty packageâ€ is defined in the Scala language spec https://www.scala-lang.org/files/archive/spec/2.12/09-top-level-definitions.html#packagings

In the Java language spec the same package is called â€œunnamedâ€.

We are dealing with SemanticDB symbols here where we use the â€œempty packageâ€ for both languages https://scalameta.org/docs/semanticdb/specification.html#symbol-1
